Interface IRenderer

Namespace
osu.Framework.Graphics.Rendering
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

Draws to the screen.

INDICES_PER_QUAD 

public const int INDICES_PER_QUAD = 6

Field Value

int

MAX_DRAW_NODES

Maximum number of DrawNodes a Drawable can draw with. This is a carefully-chosen number to enable the update and draw threads to work concurrently without causing unnecessary load.

public const int MAX_DRAW_NODES = 3

Field Value

int

IsClipSpaceYInverted

Whether the y-coordinate ranges from -1 (top) to 1 (bottom). If false, the y-coordinate ranges from -1 (bottom) to 1 (top).

bool IsClipSpaceYInverted { get; }

Property Value

bool

IsDepthRangeZeroToOne

Whether the depth is in the range [0, 1] (i.e. Reversed-Z). If false, depth is in the range [-1, 1].

bool IsDepthRangeZeroToOne { get; }

bool

IsMaskingActive

Whether any masking parameters are currently applied.

Property Value

bool

IsUvOriginTopLeft

Whether the texture coordinates begin in the top-left of the texture. If false, (0, 0) corresponds to the bottom-left texel of the texture.

bool IsUvOriginTopLeft { get; }

Property Value

bool

MaxPixelsUploadedPerFrame

The maximum number of pixels to upload per frame. Defaults to 2 megapixels (8mb alloc).

int MaxPixelsUploadedPerFrame { get; set; }

ClearCurrent()

Invoked when the rendering thread is suspended and no more commands will be enqueued. This is mainly required for OpenGL renderers to mark context as current before performing GL calls.

void ClearCurrent()

CreateShaderStorageBufferObject<TData>(int, int)

Creates a buffer that can be used to store an array of data for use in a IShader.

IShaderStorageBufferObject<TData> CreateShaderStorageBufferObject<TData>(int uboSize, int ssboSize) where TData : unmanaged, IEquatable<TData>

Parameters

uboSize int

The number of elements this buffer should contain if Shader Storage Buffer Objects are not supported by the platform. A safe value is 16384/{data_size}. The value must match the definition of the UBO implementation in the shader.

ssboSize int

The number of elements this buffer should contain if Shader Storage Buffer Objects are supported by the platform. May be any value up to {vram_size}/{data_size}.

Returns

IShaderStorageBufferObject<TData>

An IShaderStorageBufferObject<TData>.

Type Parameters

TData

The type of data to be stored in the buffer.

Remarks

  • Internally, this buffer may be implemented as either a "Uniform Buffer Object" (UBO) or a "Shader Storage Buffer Object" (SSBO) depending on the capabilities of the platform.
  • UBOs are more broadly supported but cannot hold as much data as SSBOs.
  • Shaders must provide implementations for both types of buffers to properly support this storage.

CreateTexture(int, int, bool, TextureFilteringMode, WrapMode, WrapMode, Color4?)

Creates a new Texture.

Texture CreateTexture(int width, int height, bool manualMipmaps = false, TextureFilteringMode filteringMode = TextureFilteringMode.Linear, WrapMode wrapModeS = WrapMode.None, WrapMode wrapModeT = WrapMode.None, Color4? initialisationColour = null)

Parameters

width int

The width of the texture.

height int

The height of the texture.

manualMipmaps bool

Whether manual mipmaps will be uploaded to the texture. If false, the texture will compute mipmaps automatically.

filteringMode TextureFilteringMode

The filtering mode.

wrapModeS WrapMode

The texture's horizontal wrap mode.

wrapModeT WrapMode

The texture's vertex wrap mode.

initialisationColour Color4?

The colour to initialise texture levels with (in the case of sub region initial uploads). If null, no initialisation is provided out-of-the-box.

Returns

Texture

The Texture.

WaitUntilIdle()

Waits until all renderer commands have been fully executed GPU-side, as signaled by the graphics backend.

void WaitUntilIdle()

Remarks

This is equivalent to a glFinish call.

Waits until the GPU signals that the next frame is ready to be rendered.
